etymology.description: Semantic: 酉(酉) (yǒu, "alcohol") + Phonetic: 穌(穌) (sū, "resuscitate") = alcohol-related quality -> crisp, flaky
etymology.interpretation: The character combines the alcohol radical with a phonetic element related to resuscitation, symbolizing a texture or quality often associated with alcohol or fermentation, like the crispness or flakiness in certain foods.

examples.chinese: 这酥皮蛋糕香甜(這酥皮蛋糕香甜)，入口即化(入口即化)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè sū pí dàngāo xiāngtián, rùkǒu jíhuà.
examples.english: This flaky-layered cake is sweet and melts in your mouth.
The cookies are crisp and flaky.

examples.chinese: 她做的酥饼外皮酥脆(她做的酥餅外皮酥脆)，内馅香浓(內餡香濃)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zuò de sū bǐng wàipí sūcuì, nèixiàn xiāngnóng.
examples.english: The pastries she made have a crispy exterior and a richly flavored filling.
